subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Report for each Iteration
msgSnippet: Hi Harshal, Here is how you could do this with TestNG and DataProviders: @DataProvider(name = xmlProvider ) public Object[][] createMergeCombinations() {
messageBody:
Hi Harshal,

Here is how you could do this with TestNG and DataProviders:

@DataProvider(name = "xmlProvider")
public Object[][] createMergeCombinations() {
String f1 = "xml1.xml";
String f2 = "xml2.xml";
String f3 = "xml3.xml";

return new Object[] {
return new Object[] { f1, f1},
return new Object[] { f1, f2},
return new Object[] { f1, f3},
return new Object[] { f2, f1},
return new Object[] { f2, f2},
return new Object[] { f2, f3},
return new Object[] { f3, f1},
return new Object[] { f3, f2},
return new Object[] { f3, f3},
}

return result;
}

private XmlDocument merge(String f1, String f2) {
// merge files
}

@Test(dataProvider = "xmlProvider")
public void verifyMerge(String f1, String f2) {
XmlDocument m = merge(f1, f2);
// verify the merged document
}

Note that the @Test method receives two parameters, which are defined in the
dataprovider. The dataprovider will return all nine combinations of files
and TestNG will invoke your test method with each of them. If one fails,
this particular combination will be marked as a failure and TestNG will move
on to the next invocation. Finally, the reports will tell you which ones
succeeded and which ones failed, along with the parameters that were in use
at that time...

Hope it helps.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


On 7/31/06, Harshal Shah <shahharshal@...> wrote:
>
> The question is more of implementation details but I was interested to
> know
> if there are API's or easy solution availables.
>
> Here's the problem:
>
> I have 3 xml files (xml1,xml2,xml3). I am testing the merging of these xml
> files. The following could be possible
>
> xml1-xml1
> xml1-xml2
> xml1-xml3
> xml3-xml1
> xml3-xml2
> xml3-xml3
>
> One method is to write testMethods for all these combination.
> One more approach is just write two for loops which will do this for
> me.Theproblem with this approach is the method is just single. Due to
> this, what
> is happening is the JUnit report just shows a single success or failure.
>
> I tried Anonymous Inner class approach but that did not work.
>
> Can somebody point me to some different approach to just have all the
> results displayed using just a single mehtod or some solution like this?
>
> -Thanks
>
> --
> http://shahharshal.blogspot.com/
>
